contentrichtext.text: :''see also [[Reedy Island (Assawoman Bay)]] and [[Reedy Island (Isle of Wight Bay)]] in [[Maryland]].'' '''Reedy Island''' is a small island in the middle of the channel of the [[Delaware River]] near its mouth on [[Delaware Bay]] in the [[U.S. state]] of [[Delaware]]. It is located approximately 1 mi (1.6 km) east of [[Port Penn, Delaware]] and 5 mi (8 km) southwest of [[Salem, New Jersey]]. The island was the location of [[Reedy Island Range Front Light]]. The Reedy Island Range Rear light, in nearby Taylors Bridge, is a historic [[lighthouse]] first established in 1910. The light is operated by the [[United States Coast Guard]]. The nearby keeper's house was destroyed by [[arson]] in 2002. ==See also== *[[Pea Patch Island]] ==External links== *[http://www.cr.nps.gov/maritime/light/reedy.htm National Park Service: Reedy Island Range Rear Light] *[http://www.lighthousefriends.com/light.asp?ID=457 LighthouseFriends.com: Reedy Island Range Rear Light] {{coord|39|30|55|N|75|33|47|W|display=title}} {{Delaware}} [[Category:Islands of Delaware]] [[Category:Landforms of New Castle County, Delaware]]
